intro: Limonium avei, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which help it thrive in salty, windy environments. The plant belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is often found growing in dunes and rocky shores. Limonium avei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in gardens and floral arrangements. Its ability to tolerate harsh conditions makes it a resilient and adaptable species.
